page.title: 04FRANKTON CHURCH & BUILDINGS
page.content: {FRANKTON CHURCH}WAS BUILT IN{1820. THE ROOF IS MADE OF LEAD, AND THE REST OF THE CHURCH IS MADE OF STONE. THE CHURCH HAS SERVICES EVERY SUNDAY AT 11:00 a.m. THE{VILLAGE HALL}IS USED EVERY TWO WEEKS FOR SUNDAY SCHOOL. A FETE IS HELD THERE ABOUT ONCE A YEAR. THERE USED TO BE A PLAY GROUP THERE BUT THERE ISN'T ANY MORE. OUTSIDE THE VILLAGE HALL THERE IS A NOTICE BOARD WHICH TELLS PEOPLE ABOUT EVENTS IN THE VILLAGE. THE{FRIENDLY INN}HAS BEEN RENOVATED AND NEW PEOPLE HAVE MOVED IN AND THEY HAVE ABOUT TWENTY PEOPLE IN EVERY DAY. THESE PEOPLE GO IN MOSTLY IN THE EVENING. THE SIGN OUTSIDE HAS A MAN ON IT DRINKING A GLASS OF BEER. {THE MANOR}IS OWNED BY {MRS. PRICE.}THE MANOR HAS A FETE ABOUT EVERY TWO YEARS. THERE WERE TWO MANORS IN FRANKTON BUT THERE IS ONLY ONE NOW.
